intro: Hololeion maximowiczii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and wetlands. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or yellowish in color. Hololeion maximowiczii is often considered an invasive species in regions outside its native range.
